intro: Virecta kaessneri, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with strap-like leaves that are dark green and glossy. Virecta kaessneri thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. It is also noted for its ability to bloom reliably in coastal climates.
